visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing monthly sales and production cost trends over 10 months using dual-axis encoding with synthetic business data

title.text: Styling Axes: Monthly Sales vs Production Costs (2023)

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two time-series dimensions tracking monthly business metrics across 10 consecutive months. Synthetic sales data (μ=178, σ=34) follows a seasonal pattern with summer peak, while cost data (μ=272, σ=32) demonstrates controlled reduction. Both series maintain domain-appropriate ranges and temporal consistency. The dual-axis column chart effectively separates metric scales while maintaining temporal alignment, adhering to Tufte's principles by minimizing non-data ink through shared category labels. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through color-coded axes (blue for sales, red for costs) and proportional column widths. The 5px borderRadius improves visual appeal without compromising data integrity, while ungrouped columns enable direct month-to-month comparison between metrics.
